content:
I have the townie go! 7D step over. I had the bike for quite some time before I even realized there was an app.
I liked that app once I started using it, however, it has a major flaw. It randomly disconnects mid-ride, and that causes your electric motor to shut down. I've reached out with multiple emails to Trek, but no support so far. 
It also doesn't return to the information for the ride up to that point, which means that you will see something like 15 minutes of a two hour ride. Extremely frustrating.

It would be great to have it graphically integrated into one app.  Other than that the app works great for me, it shows me battery, speed, power, distance, heartrate and logs my ride to Strava seamlessly. author: US757

content:
App works well for basic functionality with the bike. You can tune the motor, you can configure the sensors, you can track rides.

However, integration with the Apple ecosystem is very poor. Can‚Äôt use the Apple Watch to track heart rate. Can‚Äôt export any activities to Apple health. This means you have to use multiple apps for any health tracking, which is doubly unfortunate because the Trek Central app has all of the motor vs human data, so can provide a much more accurate picture than e.g. Strava or Wahoo.

I hope they rectify this in a future version, and I will update my review if they do.
author: freerobby

content: I‚Äôve had this bike for a little over a year and it has been fine, everything except this app. The developers should honestly be embarrassed. It was horrible before this update, now the bike doesn‚Äôt even connect to the app. It used to take anywhere from 2-5 minutes HOLDING COMPLETELY STILL for it to connect to the app. Even then, it would disconnect MID RIDE 25% of the time, it‚Äôs horrible. What‚Äôs worse, when the bike is attempting to connect, and you‚Äôre riding it, it stutter stops and sometimes turns off, which is incredibly dangerous. I‚Äôm writing this while waiting in a line, not 20 feet from my bike and it couldn‚Äôt find it anymore, so I don‚Äôt even know if it will work anymore. To the developers, maybe ride the bike to see how awful your app is, before patting yourself on the back. It‚Äôs been almost a year before this update rolled out, nothing between then and now, and nothing that was bad was fixed. You added nonsense to the app, only over complicating things. Fix the connection issues, the disconnection issues (basically the safety issues, which don‚Äôt exist on regular bikes). This app is pathetic.

author: TBonzai

content:
I rated this app at 4 stars. It would have been 5 if‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

It is a real PITA to have to go through the process of pairing the second bike and ‚Äúlosing‚Äù the first every time I want to review the other bike‚Äôs data. If that were possible, then I would rate it 5 stars. Edit: Additionally, I have reported this to my local Trek dealer that when connected to my Dual Sport+ 2, the app recommends tire pressures for both wheels ridiculously low (in the 20s, PSI, while the tire wall says maximum 50 psi). If I followed the app‚Äôs recommendation, I would be riding to ‚ÄúPinch Flat City.‚Äù

It‚Äôs really random. The actual bike odometer does not get the miles added, just the current ride/trip odometer.  This obviously then skews the other stats (avg speed, etc.) for the ride.
